p:
Unique SMILES were used to generate the 3D models as well as the calculation of drug metabolism and pharmacokinetics (DMPK) properties of the collected molecules in our dataset using LigPrep and QikProp packages, respectively, of the Schrodinger software, as previously described.
[22] Some of the computed properties of interest included molecular weight ( mol_MW), the number of H‐bonds that would be donated/accepted by the solute to water molecules in an aqueous solution ( donor/accptHB), the number of non‐trivial (not CX3), non‐hindered (not alkene, amide, small ring) rotatable bonds ( #rotor), the computed octanol/water partition coefficient ( QPlogP
o/w ), predicted IC 50 value for the blockage of HERG potassium ion (K +) channels ( QPlogHERG), predicted brain/blood partition coefficient ( QPlogBB), predicted skin permeability ( QPlogK p ), the number of likely metabolic reactions ( #metab), prediction of binding to human serum albumin ( QPlogK hsa ), the number of violations of Lipinski's “rule of five” ( RuleOfFive) and the number of violations of Jorgensen's rule of three ( RuleOfThree).
